attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.comment: In some models part of carbon (e.g., root exudate) can go directly into the soil pool without entering litter.
attributes.description: Carbon mass flux per unit area from vegetation directly into soil, without intermediate conversion to litter.
attributes.longname: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation Directly to Soil

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.comment: "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. "Surface litter" means the part of the litter resting above the soil surface. "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. The sum of the quantities with standard names surface_litter_mass_content_of_carbon and subsurface_litter_mass_content_of_carbon has the standard name litter_mass_content_of_carbon.
attributes.description: "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. "Surface litter" means the part of the litter resting above the soil surface. "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. The sum of the quantities with standard names surface_litter_mass_content_of_carbon and subsurface_litter_mass_content_of_carbon has the standard name litter_mass_content_of_carbon.
attributes.longname: Carbon Mass in Above-Ground Litter

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.comment: including fine and coarse roots.
attributes.description: Carbon mass per unit area in roots, including fine and coarse roots.
attributes.longname: Carbon Mass in Roots

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.comment: Carbon mass per unit area in woody debris (dead organic matter composed of coarse wood.  It is distinct from litter)
attributes.description: Carbon mass per unit area in woody debris (dead organic matter composed of coarse wood.  It is distinct from litter)
attributes.longname: Carbon Mass in Coarse Woody Debris

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.comment: Carbon mass flux per unit area due to crop harvesting
attributes.description: Carbon mass flux per unit area due to crop harvesting
attributes.longname: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Crop Harvesting [kgC m-2 s-1]

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
attributes.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by bare soil.
attributes.description: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by bare soil.
attributes.longname: Bare Soil Percentage Area Coverage

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.comment: "Production of carbon" means the production of biomass expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. Net primary production is the excess of gross primary production (rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors) by autotrophs ("producers"), for example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton, over the rate at which the autotrophs themselves respire some of this biomass. "Productivity" means production per unit area. The phrase "expressed_as" is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A.
attributes.description: "Production of carbon" means the production of biomass expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. Net primary production is the excess of gross primary production (rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors) by autotrophs ("producers"), for example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton, over the rate at which the autotrophs themselves respire some of this biomass. "Productivity" means production per unit area. The phrase "expressed_as" is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A.
attributes.longname: Net Primary Production on Land as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
attributes.comment: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by secondary evergreen trees.
attributes.description: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by secondary evergreen trees.
attributes.longname: Percentage Cover by Secondary Evergreen Trees

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.comment: A ratio obtained by dividing the total upper leaf surface area of vegetation by the (horizontal) surface area of the land on which it grows.
attributes.description: A ratio obtained by dividing the total upper leaf surface area of vegetation by the (horizontal) surface area of the land on which it grows.
attributes.longname: Leaf Area Index

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.comment: fast is meant as lifetime of more than 100 years for  reference climate conditions (20 C, no water limitations)
attributes.description: Carbon mass per unit area in slow soil pool. Slow means a lifetime of more than 100 years for reference climate (20th century) in the absence of water limitations.
attributes.longname: Carbon Mass in Slow Soil Pool

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.comment: This is the rate of carbon uptake by roots due to NPP
attributes.description: This is the rate of carbon uptake by roots due to NPP
attributes.longname: Net Primary Production Allocated to Roots as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
attributes.comment: fraction of entire grid cell  that is land and is covered by "non-vegetation" and "non-bare-soil" (e.g., urban, ice, lakes, etc.)
attributes.description: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is land and is covered by  neither vegetation nor bare-soil (e.g., urban, ice, lakes, etc.)
attributes.longname: Percentage of Grid Cell That Is Land but neither Vegetation Covered nor Bare Soil

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.comment: Growth respiration is defined as the additional carbon cost for the synthesis of new growth.
attributes.description: Growth respiration is defined as the additional carbon cost for the synthesis of new growth.
attributes.longname: Total Autotrophic Respiration on Land as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.comment: medium is meant as lifetime of more than than 10 years and less than 100 years for  reference climate conditions (20 C, no water limitations)
attributes.description: Carbon mass per unit area in medium (rate) soil pool. Medium means a lifetime of more than than 10 years and less than 100 years for reference climate conditions (20th century) in the absence of water limitations.
attributes.longname: Carbon Mass in Medium Soil Pool

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.comment: This is the net mass flux of carbon between land and atmosphere calculated as photosynthesis MINUS the sum of  plant and soil respiration, carbonfluxes  from fire, harvest, grazing  and land use change. Positive flux  is into the land.
attributes.description: This is the net mass flux of carbon from atmosphere into land, calculated as photosynthesis MINUS the sum of  plant and soil respiration, carbon fluxes from fire, harvest, grazing  and land use change. Positive flux is into the land.
attributes.longname: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Net Biospheric Production on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.comment: the precipitation flux that is intercepted by the vegetation canopy (if present in model) before reaching the ground.
attributes.description: The precipitation flux that is intercepted by the vegetation canopy (if present in model) before reaching the ground.
attributes.longname: Precipitation onto Canopy

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.comment: CO2 emissions (expressed as a carbon mass flux) from natural fires + human ignition fires as calculated by the fire module of the DGVM, but excluding any CO2 flux from fire included in fLuc, defined below (CO2 Flux to Atmosphere from Land Use Change).
attributes.description: CO2 emissions (expressed as a carbon mass flux per unit area) from natural fires and human ignition fires as calculated by the fire module of the dynamic vegetation model, but excluding any CO2 flux from fire included in fLuc (CO2 Flux to Atmosphere from Land Use Change).
attributes.longname: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from Fire Excluding Land-Use Change [kgC m-2 s-1]

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.comment: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to heterotrophic respiration on land (respiration by consumers)
attributes.description: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to heterotrophic respiration on land (respiration by consumers)
attributes.longname: Total Heterotrophic Respiration on Land as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.comment: Transpiration (may include dew formation as a negative flux).
attributes.description: Transpiration (may include dew formation as a negative flux).
attributes.longname: Transpiration

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
attributes.comment: The categories may differ from model to model, depending on their  PFT definitions.   This may include natural PFTs, anthropogenic PFTs, bare soil, lakes, urban areas, etc.   Sum of all should equal the fraction of the grid-cell that is land.
attributes.description: Percentage of grid cell area occupied by different model vegetation/land cover categories. The categories may differ from model to model, depending on each model's subgrid land cover category definitions. Categories may include natural vegetation, anthropogenic vegetation, bare soil, lakes, urban areas, glaciers, etc. Sum of all should equal the percentage of the grid cell that is land.
attributes.longname: Percentage of Area by Vegetation or Land-Cover Category

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
attributes.comment: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by anthropogenic pasture.
attributes.description: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by anthropogenic pasture.
attributes.longname: Percentage of Land Which Is Anthropogenic Pasture

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.comment: the total runoff (including "drainage" through the base of the soil model) leaving the land portion of the grid cell.
attributes.description: The total run-off (including drainage through the base of the soil model) per unit area leaving the land portion of the grid cell.
attributes.longname: Total Runoff

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.comment: "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. "subsurface litter" means the part of the litter mixed within the soil below the surface. "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. The sum of the quantities with standard names surface_litter_mass_content_of_carbon and subsurface_litter_mass_content_of_carbon has the standard name litter_mass_content_of_carbon.
attributes.description: "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. "subsurface litter" means the part of the litter mixed within the soil below the surface. "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. The sum of the quantities with standard names surface_litter_mass_content_of_carbon and subsurface_litter_mass_content_of_carbon has the standard name litter_mass_content_of_carbon.
attributes.longname: Carbon Mass in Below-Ground Litter

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.comment: the mass (summed over all all layers) of frozen water.
attributes.description: The mass per unit area (summed over all model layers) of frozen water.
attributes.longname: Soil Frozen Water Content

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.comment: the mass per unit area  (summed over all soil layers) of water in all phases.
attributes.description: the mass per unit area  (summed over all soil layers) of water in all phases.
attributes.longname: Total Soil Moisture Content

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
attributes.comment: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by primary evergreen trees.
attributes.description: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by primary evergreen trees.
attributes.longname: Percentage Cover by Primary Evergreen Trees

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. "Vegetation" means any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. The sum of the quantities with standard names mass_flux_of_carbon_into_litter_from_vegetation_due_to_mortality and mass_flux_of_carbon_into_litter_from_vegetation_due_to_senescence is mass_flux_of_carbon_into_litter_from_vegetation.
attributes.description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. "Vegetation" means any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. The sum of the quantities with standard names mass_flux_of_carbon_into_litter_from_vegetation_due_to_mortality and mass_flux_of_carbon_into_litter_from_vegetation_due_to_senescence is mass_flux_of_carbon_into_litter_from_vegetation.
attributes.longname: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
attributes.comment: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by shrub.
attributes.description: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by shrub.
attributes.longname: Percentage Cover by Shrub

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.comment: Carbon mass flux per unit area due to grazing on land
attributes.description: Carbon mass flux per unit area due to grazing on land
attributes.longname: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Grazing on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.comment: This is the rate of carbon uptake by wood due to NPP
attributes.description: This is the rate of carbon uptake by wood due to NPP
attributes.longname: Net Primary Production Allocated to Wood as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
attributes.comment: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by trees.
attributes.description: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by trees.
attributes.longname: Tree Cover Percentage

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.comment: the mass of water in all phases in a thin surface soil layer.
attributes.description: The mass of water in all phases in the upper 10cm of the  soil layer.
attributes.longname: Moisture in Upper Portion of Soil Column

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.comment: Carbon mass flux per unit area into soil from litter (dead plant material in or above the soil).
attributes.description: Carbon mass flux per unit area into soil from litter (dead plant material in or above the soil).
attributes.longname: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Litter to Soil

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.comment: fast is meant as lifetime of less than 10 years for  reference climate conditions (20 C, no water limitations).
attributes.description: Carbon mass per unit area in fast soil pool. Fast means a lifetime of less than 10 years for reference climate conditions (20th century) in the absence of water limitations.
attributes.longname: Carbon Mass in Fast Soil Pool

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.comment: Carbon mass per unit area in that has been removed from the environment through  land use change.
attributes.description: Carbon mass per unit area in that has been removed from the environment through  land use change.
attributes.longname: Carbon Mass in Products of Land-Use Change

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.comment: Maintenance respiration is defined as the carbon cost to support the metabolic activity of existing live tissue.
attributes.description: Maintenance respiration is defined as the carbon cost to support the metabolic activity of existing live tissue.
attributes.longname: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Maintenance Autotrophic Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
attributes.comment: Percentage of grid cell burned due to all fires including natural and anthropogenic fires and those associated with anthropogenic land use change
attributes.description: Percentage of grid cell burned due to all fires including natural and anthropogenic fires and those associated with anthropogenic Land-use change
attributes.longname: Percentage of Entire Grid Cell That Is Covered by Burnt Vegetation (All Classes)

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
attributes.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by C4 PFTs (including grass and crops).
attributes.description: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by C4 PFTs (including grass and crops).
attributes.longname: Percentage Cover by C4 Plant Functional Type

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.comment: includes sublimation.
attributes.description: Water evaporation from soil (including sublimation).
attributes.longname: Water Evaporation from Soil

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.comment: "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. The sum of the quantities with standard names surface_litter_mass_content_of_carbon and subsurface_litter_mass_content_of_carbon has the standard name litter_mass_content_of_carbon.
attributes.description: "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. The sum of the quantities with standard names surface_litter_mass_content_of_carbon and subsurface_litter_mass_content_of_carbon has the standard name litter_mass_content_of_carbon.
attributes.longname: Carbon Mass in Litter Pool

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.comment: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to autotrophic respiration on land (respiration by producers) [see rh for heterotrophic production]
attributes.description: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to autotrophic respiration on land (respiration by producers) [see rh for heterotrophic production]
attributes.longname: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Autotrophic (Plant) Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.comment: Temperature of each soil layer.  Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea".
attributes.description: Temperature of soil. Reported as missing for grid cells with no land.
attributes.longname: Temperature of Soil

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
attributes.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by C3 PFTs (including grass, crops, and trees).
attributes.description: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by C3 PFTs (including grass, crops, and trees).
attributes.longname: Percentage Cover by C3 Plant Functional Type

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.comment: This is the rate of carbon uptake by leaves due to NPP
attributes.description: This is the rate of carbon uptake by leaves due to NPP
attributes.longname: Net Primary Production Allocated to Leaves as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.comment: the total surface runoff leaving the land portion of the grid cell.
attributes.description: The total surface run off leaving the land portion of the grid cell (excluding drainage through the base of the soil model).
attributes.longname: Surface Runoff

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.comment: Carbon mass per unit area in vegetation.
attributes.description: Carbon mass per unit area in vegetation.
attributes.longname: Carbon Mass in Vegetation

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
attributes.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by crop.
attributes.description: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by crop.
attributes.longname: Percentage Crop Cover

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.comment: Carbon mass per unit area in leaves.
attributes.description: Carbon mass per unit area in leaves.
attributes.longname: Carbon Mass in Leaves

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.comment: the canopy evaporation+sublimation (if present in model).
attributes.description: The canopy evaporation and sublimation (if present in model); may include dew formation as a negative flux.
attributes.longname: Evaporation from Canopy

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
attributes.comment: This is the fraction of the entire grid cell  that is covered by "total primary deciduous trees."
attributes.description: Percentage of the entire grid cell  that is covered by total primary deciduous trees.
attributes.longname: Percentage Cover by Primary Deciduous Tree

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
attributes.comment: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by secondary deciduous trees.
attributes.description: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by secondary deciduous trees.
attributes.longname: Percentage Cover by Secondary Deciduous Trees

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: mean
attributes.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell that is covered by natural grass.
attributes.description: Percentage of entire grid cell that is covered by natural grass.
attributes.longname: Natural Grass Area Percentage

attributes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
attributes.comment: The rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ("producers") expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production.
attributes.description: The rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ("producers") expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production.
attributes.longname: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Gross Primary Production on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
